sen.j: 田代重右衛門（たしろ じゅうえもん、1854年（嘉永7年）1月2日 - 1932年（昭和7年）12月14日）は、日本の実業家。
sen.e: Juemon Tashiro (January 2, 1854 to December 14, 1932) was a businessman in Japan.
Juemon Tashiro (January 2, 1854 to December 14, 1932) was a businessman in Japan.
Juemon Tashiro (January 2, 1854 to December 14, 1932) was a businessman in Japan.

sen.j: 嘉永7年1月2日、美濃国大野郡 (岐阜県)下座倉村（岐阜県）で、父重兵衛の子として生まれる。
sen.e: On January 2, 1854, he was born as a son of Jubei in Shimozagura Village, Ono District, Mino Province (Gifu Prefecture).
sen.cmt: ◆「父重兵衛」を「父、重兵衛」と解釈して訳しました。
sen.e: On January 2, 1854, he was born as a son of Jubei in Shimozagura Village, Ono District, Mino Province (Gifu Prefecture).
On January 2, 1854, he was born as a son of Jubei in Shimozagura Village, Ono District, Mino Province (Gifu Prefecture).
His childhood name was Matsutaro.
His childhood name was Matsutaro.
His childhood name was Matsutaro.

sen.j: 生家は、綿花、藍、茶商を生業とし、屋号は棉屋と称した。
sen.e: His birthplace was a store dealing with cotton, indigo as well as tea, and its yago (the name of the store) was the cotton store.
His birthplace was a store dealing with cotton, indigo as well as tea, and its yago (the name of the store) was the cotton store.
His birthplace was a store dealing with cotton, indigo as well as tea, and its yago (the name of the store) was the cotton store.

sen.j: 寺子屋で学び、11歳のころには父に従い商売にでる。
sen.e: He studied at Terakoya (a private elementary school in the Edo period), and at the age of eleven, he started in business following his father.
He studied at Terakoya (a private elementary school in the Edo period), and at the age of eleven, he started in business following his father.
He studied at Terakoya (a private elementary school in the Edo period), and at the age of eleven, he started in business following his father.

sen.j: 明治14年28歳で大阪で綿糸商を営むが、一旦郷里にひきあげる。
sen.e: When he was 28 years old in 1881, he was running business as a cotton-yarn dealer in Osaka, but moved back to his hometown once.
When he was 28 years old in 1881, he was running business as a cotton-yarn dealer in Osaka, but moved back to his hometown once.
When he was 28 years old in 1881, he was running business as a cotton-yarn dealer in Osaka, but moved back to his hometown once.

sen.j: 26年再度上阪し、尼崎紡績に入社、27年には抜擢され副支配人、34年取締役に就任した。
sen.e: In 1893, he moved to Osaka again and joined Amagasaki Spinners Ltd., where he was promoted to an assistant manager in 1894 and to a director in 1901.
In 1893, he moved to Osaka again and joined Amagasaki Spinners Ltd., where he was promoted to an assistant manager in 1894 and to a director in 1901.
In 1893, he moved to Osaka again and joined Amagasaki Spinners Ltd., where he was promoted to an assistant manager in 1894 and to a director in 1901.

sen.j: 41年東洋紡績を合併し、綿布の製造を始める。
sen.e: In 1908, he merged the company with Toyo Boseki (a spinning company), and started manufacturing menpu (cotton cloth).
sen.cmt: ◆東洋紡績→ Toyo Boseki現在ある「東洋紡績株式会社」とは違うような気がするので、「Toyobo Co., Ltd.」にはしませんでした。
sen.e: In 1908, he merged the company with Toyo Boseki (a spinning company), and started manufacturing menpu (cotton cloth).
In 1908, he merged the company with Toyo Boseki (a spinning company), and started manufacturing menpu (cotton cloth).

sen.j: のち東京紡績、日本紡績、摂津紡績を合併し、大正7年大日本紡績（現・ユニチカ）と改称した。
sen.e: Later, he also merged the company with Tokyo Boseki (a spinning company), Nippon Boseki (a spinning company) and Setsu Boseki (Setsu Spinning Ltd.), and in 1918, he changed the company name to Dainippon Spinners Co., Ltd. (current UNITICA LTD.).
sen.cmt: ◆東京紡績→ Tokyo boseki (a spinning company)＜定訳不明＞◆日本紡績→ Nippon boseki (a spinning company)＜定訳不明＞◆摂津紡績→Setsu Boseki (Setsu Spinning Ltd.)
sen.e: Later, he also merged the company with Tokyo Boseki (a spinning company), Nippon Boseki (a spinning company) and Setsu Boseki (Setsu Spinning Ltd.), and in 1918, he changed the company name to Dainippon Spinners Co., Ltd. (current UNITICA LTD.).

Later, he also merged the company with Tokyo Boseki (a spinning company), Nippon Boseki (a spinning company) and Setsu Boseki (Setsu Spinning Ltd.), and in 1918, he changed the company name to Dainippon Spinners Co., Ltd. (current UNITICA LTD.).

sen.j: その後、日本絹毛紡績を合併、鹿児島紡績を買収する。
sen.e: After that, he merged the company with Nihon Kenmo Boseki (Japan Silk & Wool Spinning), and bought Kagoshima Boseki (a spinning company).
sen.cmt: ◆日本絹毛紡績→Nihon Kenmo Boseki (Japan Silk & Wool Spinning)＜定訳不明＞◆鹿児島紡績→Kagoshima Boseki (a spinning company）＜定訳不明＞
sen.e: After that, he merged the company with Nihon Kenmo Boseki (Japan Silk & Wool Spinning), and bought Kagoshima Boseki (a spinning company).
After that, he merged the company with Nihon Kenmo Boseki (Japan Silk & Wool Spinning), and bought Kagoshima Boseki (a spinning company).
In 1924, he was assigned to be an adviser.
sen.cmt: ◆「13年」は「大正13年」として訳しました。
sen.e: In 1924, he was assigned to be an adviser.
In 1924, he was assigned to be an adviser.

sen.j: 同時に日本貯蓄銀行相談役なども兼任した。
sen.e: He was also an adviser to Nippon Savings Bank.
sen.cmt: ◆日本貯蓄銀行→Nippon Savings Bank＜定訳不明＞
sen.e: He was also an adviser to Nippon Savings Bank.
He was also an adviser to Nippon Savings Bank.
